metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5380 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Utf8DecoderBase::WriteUtf16Slow function in unicode-decoder.cc in Google V8, as used in Node.js before 0.12.6, io.js before 1.8.3 and 2.x before 2.3.3, and other products, does not verify that there is memory available for a UTF-16 surrogate pair, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted byte sequence.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5380` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 8.10.0~dfsg-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> Does not affect Node.js before 0.12.0

criterions.comment: nodejs package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.10.0~dfsg-2').
